name: Cache System
description: As a developer
I want VM type data to be cached for performance
So that scripts don't reparse configuration on every invocation

elements.name: Cache VM types after first load

steps.name: VM types are loaded for the first time
cache file should be created at ".cache/vm-types.cache"
cache file should contain all VM type data

elements.name: Load from cache when config unchanged

steps.name: vm-types.conf has not been modified since cache
data should be loaded from cache

elements.name: Invalidate cache when config is modified

steps.name: vm-types.conf has been modified after cache
VM types cache exists and is valid

elements.name: Cache stores all VM type arrays

steps.name: ports have been allocated for VMs
each VM should be mapped to its port
allocated ports should be available without scanning compose files
removed VM should be removed from registry

elements.name: Rebuild port registry from compose files

steps.name: port registry cache is missing or invalid
registry should be rebuilt by scanning docker-compose files
all allocated ports should be discovered

elements.name: Cache directory is created if missing

steps.name: cache file was created before config file
cache file is newer than config file

elements.name: Lazy load VM types only when needed

steps.name: no VM operations have been performed
VM types should be loaded at that time

elements.name: Manual cache invalidation with clear command

steps.name: next load should rebuild cache from source
VM types are loaded multiple times
cache file modification time should remain unchanged

elements.name: Port registry cache invalidates on VM removal

steps.name: port registry cache exists for multiple VMs
removed VM port should be freed from registry
cache file should reflect updated allocations

elements.name: Port registry cache persists and survives restart

steps.name: ports have been allocated for VMs
previously allocated ports should be restored
cache is read by multiple processes simultaneously
all reads should return valid data
cache file should not become corrupted

name: Daily Development Workflow
description: As documented in the VDE development workflows
I want to follow the same patterns that are documented
So that the tests match the documentation exactly

elements.name: Example 1 - Python API with PostgreSQL Setup

steps.name: I am following the documented Python API workflow
I plan to create a Python VM
the plan should include the create_vm intent
the plan should include the Python VM

elements.name: Example 1 - Create PostgreSQL for Python API

steps.name: I have planned to create Python
the plan should include the create_vm intent
the plan should include the PostgreSQL VM

elements.name: Example 1 - Start Both Python and PostgreSQL

steps.name: I have created Python and PostgreSQL VMs
I plan to start both VMs
the plan should include the start_vm intent
the plan should include both Python and PostgreSQL VMs

elements.name: Example 1 - Get Connection Info for Python

steps.name: I need to connect to the Python VM
the plan should include the connect intent
the plan should include the Python VM
I have started the PostgreSQL VM
the VM should be recognized as a valid VM type
it should be marked as a service VM
I am following the documented JavaScript workflow
I plan to create JavaScript and Redis VMs
the plan should include both VMs
the JavaScript VM should use the js canonical name
I want to use the Node.js name
I can use either name in commands
I am creating a microservices architecture
I plan to create Python, Go, Rust, PostgreSQL, and Redis
the plan should include all five VMs
each VM should be included in the VM list
I have created the microservice VMs
I plan to start them all
the plan should include the start_vm intent
all microservice VMs should be included

elements.name: Example 3 - Verify All Microservice VMs Exist

steps.name: I check for each service VM
Python should exist as a language VM
Go should exist as a language VM
Rust should exist as a language VM
PostgreSQL should exist as a service VM
Redis should exist as a service VM
I am starting my development day
I plan to start Python, PostgreSQL, and Redis
the plan should include all three VMs
the plan should use the start_vm intent

elements.name: Daily Workflow - Check Status During Development

steps.name: the plan should include the status intent
I should be able to see running VMs

elements.name: Daily Workflow - Connect to Primary VM

steps.name: I need to work in my primary development environment
I ask how to connect to Python
the plan should provide connection details
the plan should include the Python VM
I am done with development for the day
the plan should include the stop_vm intent
the plan should apply to all running VMs
I should see which VMs are running
I need to rebuild a VM to fix an issue
the plan should include the restart_vm intent
the plan should set rebuild=true flag
I need to debug inside a container
I ask to connect to Python
the plan should include the connect intent
I should receive SSH connection information

elements.name: New Project Setup - Discover Available VMs

steps.name: I am setting up a new project
I ask what VMs can I create
the plan should include the list_vms intent
I should see all available VM types

elements.name: New Project Setup - Choose Full Stack

steps.name: I want a Python API with PostgreSQL
I plan to create Python and PostgreSQL
both VMs should be included in the plan
the plan should use the create_vm intent
I have an existing Python and PostgreSQL stack
the plan should include the create_vm intent
the Redis VM should be included
I have created the Redis VM
the plan should include the start_vm intent
Redis should start without affecting other VMs
I am working on one project
I plan to stop all VMs
all running VMs should be stopped
I should be ready to start a new project
I have stopped my current project
I plan to start Go and MongoDB
the new project VMs should start
only the new project VMs should be running
I am a new team member
I ask to list all languages
I should see only language VMs
service VMs should not be included
I am new to the team
I ask how to connect to Python
I should receive clear connection instructions
I should understand how to access the VM
I am learning the VDE system
I should understand what I can do
I have a Python VM that is already running
execution would detect the VM is already running
I would be notified that it's already running
I have a stopped PostgreSQL VM
execution would detect the VM is not running
I would be notified that it's already stopped
I already have a Go VM configured
I plan to create Go again
execution would detect the VM already exists
I would be notified of the existing VM
the documentation shows specific VM examples
Python should be a valid VM type
JavaScript should be a valid VM type
all microservice VMs should be valid
I need to plan my daily workflow
I generate plans for morning setup, checks, and cleanup
all plans should be generated quickly
the total time should be under 500ms

name: Natural Language Parser
description: As a developer
I want to control VDE using natural language commands
So that I don't need to remember specific command syntax

steps.name: I parse "start python, rust, and go"
VMs should include all known VMs
VMs should include all known VMs
I parse "rebuild python with no cache"
I parse "show status of python and rust"

arguments.value: show status of python and rust
arguments.name: input_text

steps.name: I parse "how do I connect to python"

arguments.value: how do I connect to python
arguments.name: input_text

elements.name: Detect what can I do intent
Extract VM names from natural input

steps.name: I parse "I want to start the python and rust vms"

arguments.value: I want to start the python and rust vms
arguments.name: input_text

elements.name: Handle special characters in input safely

steps.name: all plan lines should be valid

elements.name: Reject pipe character in VM names
Reject asterisk wildcard in VM names
Detect restart intent before start intent
Detect start when restart not specified
Handle multiple consecutive spaces in VM list
Handle commas and conjunctions for multiple VMs

steps.name: I parse "start python, rust, and go"

name: Shell Compatibility Layer
description: As a developer
I want VDE to work in zsh
So that VDE has consistent shell behavior

elements.name: Use native associative arrays in zsh

steps.name: native zsh typeset should be used

elements.name: Set and get values in associative array (zsh)
Handle special characters in keys (hex encoding)

steps.name: original key format should be preserved

elements.name: Check if key exists in associative array
Clear all entries in associative array

steps.name: absolute script path should be returned
native associative arrays are in use
temporary storage directory should be removed

elements.name: Handle empty associative array keys iteration

steps.name: I initialize an associative array named "empty_array"
I set key "path_with_spaces" to value "/usr/local/bin with spaces here"
getting key "path_with_spaces" should return "/usr/local/bin with spaces here"
I set key "empty_value" to an empty value
getting key "empty_value" should return an empty value
I set key "emoji" to value "Hello World 🌍"

elements.name: Get non-existent key should fail gracefully
Unset non-existent key should not error

name: VDE SSH Commands
description: As a VDE user
I want to manage SSH through the vde command interface
So that I have a consistent CLI for all VDE operations

steps.name: status command should show SSH environment state
VDE SSH environment is not initialized
SSH key should have correct permissions
public key should be synced to build context
init command should show completion message

elements.name: Start SSH agent and load key

steps.name: SSH agent should have VDE key loaded

elements.name: Sync SSH keys to build context

steps.name: public key should be synced to build context
sync command should show success message

elements.name: Start VM with SSH update flag

steps.name: either the command succeeds or VM is not created
VDE SSH environment is not initialized
public key should be synced to build context
SSH agent should have VDE key loaded

name: VM Information and Discovery
description: As a developer using VDE
I want to discover what VMs are available and get information about them
So I can make informed decisions about my development environment

steps.name: I ask "what VMs can I create?"
I should see all available language VMs
I should see all available service VMs
each VM should have a display name
each VM should show its type (language or service)
I want to see only programming language environments
I ask to list all languages
I should see only language VMs
I should not see service VMs
common languages like Python, Go, and Rust should be listed
I want to see only infrastructure services
I should see only service VMs
I should not see language VMs
services like PostgreSQL and Redis should be listed

elements.name: Getting detailed information about a specific VM

steps.name: I want to know about the Python VM
I should see its display name
I should see any aliases (like py, python3)
I want to verify a VM type before using it
the VM should be marked as valid
I know a VM by an alias but not its canonical name
it should resolve to the canonical name "js"
I should be able to use either name in commands
I should understand the difference between language and service VMs
language VMs should have SSH access
service VMs should provide infrastructure services

name: VM Metadata Verification
description: As a developer using VDE
I want to verify that VM metadata is correctly configured
So I can trust the VM type definitions and ensure proper system behavior

elements.name: Language VM display names are user-friendly

steps.name: I query the display name for language VMs
each language VM should have a display name
the display name should be descriptive
common languages like Python, Go, and Rust should have recognizable names

elements.name: Service VM display names are user-friendly

steps.name: I query the display name for service VMs
each service VM should have a display name
the display name should indicate the service type
services like PostgreSQL and Redis should have recognizable names

elements.name: Language VM ports are in correct range

steps.name: I check the SSH port allocation for language VMs
all language VM ports should be between 2200 and 2299
no language VM should use a service port range

elements.name: Service VM ports are in correct range

steps.name: I check the SSH port allocation for service VMs
all service VM ports should be between 2400 and 2499
no service VM should use a language port range

elements.name: VM types are correctly categorized as language

steps.name: programming language VMs should be categorized as "lang"
Python, Go, Rust, and JavaScript should be language VMs
language VMs should have SSH access configured

elements.name: VM types are correctly categorized as service

steps.name: infrastructure service VMs should be categorized as "service"
PostgreSQL, Redis, MongoDB, and Nginx should be service VMs
service VMs should have service ports configured

elements.name: Common programming language aliases resolve correctly

steps.name: I query alias mappings for programming languages
the metadata alias "python3" should map to "python"
the metadata alias "nodejs" should map to "js"
the metadata alias "golang" should map to "go"
the metadata alias "c++" should map to "cpp"
the metadata alias "rlang" should map to "r"
I query alias mappings for services
the metadata alias "postgresql" should map to "postgres"
the metadata alias "mongo" should map to "mongodb"

elements.name: Language VM container names follow naming convention

steps.name: I check container naming for language VMs
language VM containers should use the "{name}-dev" pattern

elements.name: Service VM container names follow naming convention

steps.name: I check container naming for service VMs
service VM containers should use the "{name}" pattern

elements.name: All VMs have valid installation commands

steps.name: I verify installation commands for all VMs
each VM should have a non-empty install command
the install command should be valid shell syntax

elements.name: Service VMs have service port configured

steps.name: all service VMs should have a service_port defined
the service_port should be a valid port number

elements.name: Language VMs do not have service ports configured

steps.name: I check service port configuration for language VMs
language VMs should not have service_port values
Python should not have a service_port
Go should not have a service_port

elements.name: Total VM count matches expected inventory

steps.name: the total should match the expected inventory
there should be at least 20 language VMs
there should be at least 7 service VMs
